content: frankie s knitted stuff woodland wreath oak the next leaves for the woodland wreath are two sizes of oak leaves each with their own acorns to make a change from all that green these are autumnal oak leaves knitted in brown i used sirdar click dk 150 m / 50g shade 0120 and 3 75 mm / us size 5 double pointed needles the big leaves are about 9 cm long and the small ones less than 8 cm 3 - 3½ 20 g of yarn will make eight big leaves and 10g will make the same number of small leaves big leaves the stem is worked in i cord instructions for this are at the end of the pattern using the long tail method cast on three stitches work four row in i cord now slide the stitches to the end of the needles as if you were going to carry on in i cord and cast on eight more stitches use the cable method working into the back loop only for the first stitch and then through both loops as normal after that note all slipped stitches should be slipped purlwise with the yarn held at the front of the work row 1 knit 11 sts row 2 cast on 8 sts k8 p1 sl 1 p1 k8 19 sts row 3 kf&b k7 s2kp2 k8 18 sts row 4 kf&b k7 sl 1 k9 19 sts row 5 k8 s2kp2 k8 17 sts row 6 k8 sl 1 k8 row 7 cast off 1 k5 s2kp2 k7 14 sts row 8 cast off 1 k5 sl 1 k6 13 sts row 9 cast on 3 k8 s2kp2 k5 14 sts row 10 cast on 3 k8 sl 1 k8 17 sts row 11 kf&b k6 s2kp2 k7 16 sts row 12 kf&b k6 sl 1 k8 17 sts row 13 k7 s2kp2 k7 15 sts row 14 k7 sl 1 k7 row 15 cast off 1 k4 s2kp2 k6 12 sts row 16 cast off 1 k4 sl 1 k5 11 sts row 17 cast on 3 k7 s2kp2 k4 12 sts row 18 cast on 3 k7 sl 1 k7 15 sts row 19 k6 s2kp2 k6 13 sts row 20 k6 sl 1 k6 row 21 k5 s2kp2 k5 11 sts row 22 k5 sl 1 k5 row 23 cast off 1 k2 s2kp2 k4 8 sts row 24 cast off 1 k2 sl 1 k3 7 sts row 25 k2 s2kp2 k2 5 sts row 26 k2 sl 1 k2 row 27 knit row 28 knit row 29 k3 k2tog 4 sts row 30 k2 k2tog 3 sts row 31 k1 k2tog 2 sts k2tog and fasten_off darn in the end down the centre of the leaf but leave the cast on end to sew the leaf to the wreath small leaves using the long tail method cast on three stitches work four row in i cord now slide the stitches to the end
